intro: Afroligusticum wilmsianum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and woodland edges. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Afroligusticum wilmsianum is also noted for its potential medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
